acknowledgments.summary: Cisco would like to thank global4g for reporting this vulnerability.

notes.text:
A vulnerability in the application integration feature of Cisco Webex Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to authorize an external application to integrate with and access a user's account without that user's express consent.

This vulnerability is due to improper validation of cross-site request forgery (CSRF) tokens. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing a targeted user who is currently authenticated to Cisco Webex Software to follow a link designed to pass malicious input to the Cisco Webex Software application authorization interface. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause Cisco Webex Software to authorize an application on the user's behalf without the express consent of the user, possibly allowing external applications to read data from that user's profile.

Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text: This vulnerability affects Cisco Webex Software, which is cloud based.
notes.title: Vulnerable Products

notes.text: Only products listed in the Vulnerable Products ["#vp"] section of this advisory are known to be affected by this vulnerability.
notes.title: Products Confirmed Not Vulnerable

notes.text: There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.
notes.title: Workarounds

notes.text:
Cisco has addressed this vulnerability in Cisco Webex Software, which is cloud based. No user action is required.

Customers who need additional information are advised to contact the Cisco Technical Assistance Center (TAC) or their contracted maintenance providers.

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) validates only the affected and fixed release information that is documented in this advisory.
notes.title: Fixed Software

notes.text: To learn about Cisco security vulnerability disclosure policies and publications, see the Security Vulnerability Policy ["https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/resources/security_vulnerability_policy.html"]. This document also contains instructions for obtaining fixed software and receiving security vulnerability information from Cisco.
notes.title: Vulnerability Policy

notes.text: The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
notes.title: Exploitation and Public Announcements

notes.text: Cisco would like to thank global4g for reporting this vulnerability.
